New Records: Anthony Volpe hit his first grand slam in the World Series
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's grand slam in the third inning turned the game in favor of the Yankees
Freddie Freeman gave the Dodgers an early 2-0 lead with a home run
Fan interference involving Mookie Betts led to a controversial moment early in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Aaron Boone emphasized the importance of the bullpen's performance
The Yankees relied on their bullpen to keep the game close despite a shaky start from Luis Gil
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Volpe expressed pride in his redemption after making a mistake earlier in the game
Mookie Betts downplayed the fan interference incident saying it was irrelevant to the outcome
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' bullpen performed exceptionally well, allowing only one hit over five scoreless innings
The fan interference incident involving Mookie Betts drew significant attention and reactions from both fans and players
Others: The game was played at Yankee Stadium
The series was tied 1-4 in favor of the Dodgers heading into the eighth inning
